column4: I really have no clue why setting resolution in Ubuntu is so incredible hard...
edit xorg.conf is all
what is the issue exactly?
I can only choose between 640, 800, 1024 and 1280 in the resolution setting, and 60Hz in the refresh setting..
can you set em in xorg.conf?
that has no effect what so ever.. It is as if the Screen Resolution app lives its own life...
yes it is a seperate deal can you post your xorg.conf in pastebin?
pastebin is down.. what's the name of the other one again?
beats me lol
This is the modified-to-the bone version:  http://pastebin.ca/503057
this is the original:  http://pastebin.ca/503059
what are the actual issues?
no matter what modelines I insert, it offers the same low res/refresh options in the "Screen Resolution" app
ok
I need to be able to set a usable res, like 1600x1200@75Hz
you need to change the res lines to the highest res you can use is all
add 1600.1200 on all lines
I did that... but it doesn't respect it.
did you save the file ??
yup, naturally :-)
for stuff and grins try it again
any luck
